documents.title: README
documents.summary: This document serves as the central documentation hub for ZeroClaw, providing a navigational index to installation guides, reference materials, operational runbooks, and contributor resources.

documents.title: README.ru
documents.summary: This document serves as the primary Russian-language entry point and navigation hub for the ZeroClaw documentation suite, organizing links by task, role, and category.

documents.title: README.ja
documents.summary: This document serves as the central entry point for ZeroClaw's Japanese documentation, providing a structured index of links to installation, configuration, and operational resources.

documents.title: README.zh CN
documents.summary: This document serves as the central navigation hub for the ZeroClaw documentation system, providing organized links to installation guides, reference manuals, and operational resources for different user roles.

documents.title: SUMMARY
documents.summary: This document serves as the unified table of contents and central index for the ZeroClaw documentation system, organizing links to setup guides, security designs, and operational references.

documents.title: Actions source policy
documents.summary: This document defines the Phase 1 GitHub Actions source-control policy for restricting CI/CD workflow actions to an approved allowlist. It outlines security guardrails, change control procedures, and validation steps to mitigate supply-chain risks while maintaining development velocity.

documents.title: Arduino uno q setup
documents.summary: This guide provides step-by-step instructions for installing and configuring ZeroClaw on the Arduino Uno Q to enable Telegram-based interaction and GPIO control through a specialized bridge application.

documents.title: Agnostic security
documents.summary: This document outlines a proposal for a hardware-agnostic security framework that utilizes feature flags and traits to maintain portability and performance across diverse hardware platforms.

documents.title: Adding boards and tools
documents.summary: This guide explains how to integrate and configure hardware boards, datasheets, and custom tools within the ZeroClaw environment using CLI commands and manual configuration.

documents.title: Channels reference
documents.summary: This document provides a technical reference mapping ZeroClaw's communication channel capabilities, configuration requirements, and access control behaviors.

documents.title: Audit logging
documents.summary: This document outlines a proposal for a tamper-evident audit logging system in ZeroClaw, detailing the log schema, Rust implementation, and CLI management tools.

documents.title: Ci map
documents.summary: This document provides a comprehensive map of GitHub workflows, detailing their specific purposes, trigger conditions, and roles as merge-blocking or optional checks within the repository's CI/CD pipeline.

documents.title: Commands reference
documents.summary: This document provides a comprehensive list and description of CLI commands for the ZeroClaw system, covering agent management, service lifecycles, and hardware configuration.

documents.title: Config reference
documents.summary: This document serves as a technical reference for configuring the ZeroClaw platform, detailing core settings, gateway parameters, memory backends, and security defaults for operators.
